result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth T Ambrose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 8-18-16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Restitution set at zero.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for AODA treatment and release to the ATTIC day reporting center. Provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge. May not vote in any election until civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 18 days time served
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth T Ambrose

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth T Ambrose in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 40 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 18 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for AODA treatment and release to the ATTIC day reporting center
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 8/18/2016; nonpayment penalty shall 
be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by 8/18/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-6 month drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Kenneth T Ambrose in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense withdraws motion.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Because of the possibility of incarceration, the defendant should be prepared to begin serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress received and filed./ds

Defendant Kenneth T Ambrose in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Motion hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Motion To Suppress: Motion Related To Terry Vehicle Detention; Police Questioning On Scene: Ancillary Issue Of Voluntary Consent To Police On Scene Search Of Defendant

Defendant Kenneth T Ambrose in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Certification of transcript of proceedings of  PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing APRIL 24, 2014 received and filed. (15 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Stephen Sargent - SPD  819 N 6th Street  9th Floor  Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Defendant Kenneth T Ambrose in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Kenneth T Ambrose in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Sergio Rentas.    Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #02CF3737 that are attached to the complaint. Exhibit one recieved and withdrawn. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Kenneth T Ambrose in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Kenneth T Ambrose in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
